result.execSummary:
The defendant Rob Wayne Graves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rob Wayne Graves is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rob Wayne Graves was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 15CF259.
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today August 24, 2015 no later than 4:00 p.m.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to 15CF259

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Rob Wayne Graves appeared.  Court called at 11:17 a.m.  Attorney Stormont advises there is an agreement.  DE files a plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty in 15CF103. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 15CF103.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated Guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF103. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct. 1 & Ct. 3 in 15CF103.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty in 15CF259.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 1 in 15CF259.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated Guilty of Ct. 1 15CF259.   Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  Crt orders:  


Ct. 2 on 15CF103 & Ct. 1 on 15CF259 to run concurrent
- S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE to testify fully and truthfully against DE in case 15CF102
- Court costs of $268 on each count and only a $250 DNA Surcharge on 15CF259.  Apply money on file and return balance to payor
- DE to report to probation today no later than 4:00 p.m.  
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF: Rob Wayne Graves appeared.  Court called at 1:52 p.m.  Includes case 15CF103 (PTC) & 15CF259 (Arraignment) & 13TR905 (Warrant).  Attorney Stormont advises there is an agreement.  Set out for Plea/Sentencing.  *QUASH WARRANT IN 13TR905*  DE to meet with the payment clerk.  Court adjourned.  lw Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF: Rob Wayne Graves appeared from jail.  Court called at 4:33 p.m.  ADA Mckinley advises the Court the DE has picked up a bail jumping charge.  Preliminary hearing is set on that case and then will be judicially transfered to Branch 1.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 9, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Bail is continued.  Continue PTC.  Court adjourned at 11:27 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

and __X SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $10,000 on Count 2. $500.00 Cash bond  to be posted by noon on April 3, 2015 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Obtain full time employment

- Test Wed. and Saturday's between 8-5 p.m. Responsible for drug test fee. If tests possitive, will be held

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mark E. and the Roberts Industrial Park .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Rob Wayne Graves appeared from jail. Case called at 2:07 p.m.  Atty Stormont was just given copy of the information. Court informs Def if charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and waives reading. Defendant enters a plea of NG to all 3 counts. Atty Stormont requesting signature bond. Has not been able to come up with cash. ADA Hartung has no objection to lowering cash bond but cash bond is warranted.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 11:15 am.
filed by Atty. A. Stormont. gme
to Modify Bond. Filed by Atty Stormont. km
Appointing Atty Stormont. km
Arraignment on April 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Rob Wayne Graves appeared from jail.  Court called at 11:14 a.m.  S/T of Officer Joseph Kastens of the Robert Police Department.  Direct by ADA Mckinley.  DE is identified by Officer Joseph Kastens.  Cross by Attorney Kucinski.  Re-direct by ADA Mckinley.  Re-cross by Attorney Kucinski.    DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Argument from Attorney Kucinski.  Court finds probable cause a felony was probably committed and the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Attorney Kucinski makes bond argument.  ADA Mckinley objects.  Court reserves on the bond modification until the arraignment.  Bail is continued. Court adjourned at 11:39 p.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.
